questions.question: A nlogical subdivision of an IP network. It helps manage and organize IP addresses within a network.
A data structure on a router that contains information about the routes to reach different network destinations.
It is the IP address of the router or gateway that connects a local network to other networks, such as the internet.
A technique used by routers to map multiple private IP addresses on a local network to a single public IP address for internet access.
A set of rules and conventions that govern how data is transmitted and received over a network. It defines how devices should communicate with each other.
A unique numerical label assigned to each device on a network. It is used to identify and locate devices on the internet or a local network.
A networking device that directs data traffic between different networks. It determines the most efficient path for data to travel and helps devices on a local network connect to the internet.
A device that operates at the data link layer (Layer 2) of the OSI model. It connects devices within a local network and forwards data based on MAC addresses.
